comment: Very harsh grader, gave me a zero on a quiz for reasons I still don't understand to this day.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: you should already know basic college algebra etc. if you come into this unpreprared that is on you because she hits the ground running. So many people ask questions that she had already answered. So pay attention and there should be no need for questions. If your dumb u shouldnt take her because youll get behind.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy

comment:
This instructor was kind and desired to assist students in calculus. I liked how this course came with helpful SI Sessions, and I also liked how extra credit bonuses was provided to help add-on to boost our grades. 
Would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Shi was a good teacher, at least for me. She goes over the lectures very fast, and sometimes you have to use external resources to learn it. She is very organized with grades and gives a lot of extra points on quizzes/tests. Attendance is mandatory for a grade. Her TA, at least in my semester, was great and very helpful.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment:
She's a nice person & has a strong accent. Her lectures are VERY fast-paced. She goes over 3-4 sections per lecture and it's hard to catch up if you fall behind.
Her grading system is based on points rather than percentage so that was a life saver! 4 tests( lowest is dropped), attendance is graded. I'd say take her only if you're super good at math
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor! She explains everything thoroughly and answers any questions you may have. Attendance is mandatory and I would say it plays a role in how you do in the class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: I am very surprised by the negative reviews. Her lectures are fast but understandable. She has an accent but I didn't find it hard to understand at all. I straight up slept through an exam and she said I could take it a week later. She is very caring and will work with you. She gives study guides that are exactly like the exams.
my review got deleted? anyways one star terrible professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Her lectures are very fast-paced as she will go through each chapter as fast as possible to move on to the next chapter. So if you fall behind it will be hard to catch up. Homework is more difficult than the examples in class and quizzes are given almost every day. If you do not already know calculus I would advise you not to take her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: First half of the semester was easy, but the second half she very clearly fell behind and started rushing all of us to catch up. She also is very harsh on people asking questions and grading quizzes (which can happen every day). There is also daily homework which ranges wildly in difficulty, and she doesn't review past topics in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: ended up taking her twice for 1190. failed in fall, but got a B+ in spring! while it may be because i had some of the info memorized, i noticed she made some changes that helped. she added more presentation opportunities and let us work together for the quizzes (more lenient with the quiz grades too). still a little hard, but she's not that bad!
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Despite having low ratings, professor Shi is definitely better than the bunch who teach 1190. While her accent takes time to get used to and at times she skims over explanations, she breaks down the lessons into simple and explainable example problems that can go on to help with the homework. Tests are usually problems seen on the practice test.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: She teaches the material well and gives a lot of extra credit. If you need help don't be afraid to go to her office hours, she's very nice. Attendance counts as extra credit, and grade is point-based. Study guides for the test are close to if not exactly what's on the test. Teaches off txtbk but its not needed unless you want to do the practice Qs.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I have had this professor twice. I will say, she can grade leniently and will help 1 on 1 to get your grade up but that is where the positives end. She is very critical when it comes to questions. When you ask a question that is related to algebra or trig, she will make it a point to call you out. She has outright refused to answer questions before
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: I'm surprise by the low rating. Amazing teacher and she truly cares about your learning. Test are way too easy, just do the hw and you'll be fine, she even reuses the same question from the hw on the test. She give WAY too many extra credit to the point where you can fail every test but still end up with an A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Nice person! I wish I could take her for calc2, tests are similar to hw. POP quizzes only 5 minutes, but as long as you try you will at least get a 50%
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I think its impossible to fail this class. She offers lots of ways to pass as long you do some work and she does a good job of explaining concepts and taking time to slow down if the class is struggling a bit. She does pop "quizzes" that are 1 question at random. they don't really hurt your grade and can just adds some more points you can earn.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She was a good professor. If you work hard you'll do good in her class. (ps. Someone in the class took her and said they wanna rebel against her because her hw is really hard).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Very difficult professor. Teaches too fast, but is willing to stop for questions. Homework is much more difficult than what is taught in class. Pop quizzes will happen, but are extra credit. Forgiving grading, but very difficult course. The teacher explains concepts well though, so I can give her that. I can tell she cares, but she just isn't great
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Shes fine.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Heed my warning. Don't take this professor. Extremely harsh grader, random pop quizzes with little explanation, too much homework, lectures move too fast, asking a question? she'll make you feel dumber than before you asked it. There's some extra credit however I'd avoid taking this professor at all costs. Take if like you like to suffer for fun.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Rebecca Shi was a trifecta of what makes a professor horrible: Makes you feel dumb, lectures are nothing like tests, and rushes through lectures even when class is obviously confused. The class lectures and examples are 10 times easier than the homework and test problems, and rarely if ever goes over homework problems to help prepare for the test.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Class is only lectures, and the examples in class are much easier than the homework. She moves fast through the material, has one-question quizzes, and makes you feel dumb for asking questions. This class uses MyMathLab which has so much homework and the tests are 13 questions. She does offer some extra credit, but I would just avoid her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She gives quizzes that are only 1-2 questions, so get one wrong and you're screwed. If your work is not the way she would do it, it's wrong. She makes you feel dumb for asking questions. On the positive side, the study guides are very similar to the tests, and there is a curve built into the syllabus.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: She's not the nicest in class but she is very nice outside of class. It is a standard class but the same amount of work as every other calc class. I would take her as a backup because of the amount of extra credit. She gave us 32% extra credit at the end. She prepares you well and tests are the study guide. Quizzes and attendance are extra credit.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Easy A, too much extra credit not to get an A. She struggles with English and comes off rude/mean in class, but she is mildly caring during her office hours. All test Q's come from Homework/Test Review + allows formula sheets sometimes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: I agree with all of these reviews, but my take on her is she is not very good at teaching beginning content. The first unit was a struggle but once you push past that, the class is easy. She gives SO MUCH EXTRA CREDIT it's insane. She is in fact very strict and stern in the classroom, but outside of that, she is actually very nice and very caring.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Imagine going to your first college Calculus class to be bombarded with random 1 question quizzes that impact your grade heavily. If you don't have a charged laptop to complete your random question, you're screwed. A minute late, you're screwed. Don't understand the material and need some help, you're screwed. She's an extremely difficult professor
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She was not at all a good teacher. I had to withdraw due to panic attacks and she does not take accountability for disabilities. The way she talked to students was very unsavory. EVERYONE failed the first test. The quizzes are only 1 question, and you only get 5 minutes to complete them (absolutely not enough time for most problems). DO NOT TAKE.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: JUST DONT. Don't even bother asking questions, mind as well struggle than get made fun of. She hardly explains anything and if she does its hard to follow. She is great if you have already taken calc like me, but assumes we know how to do everything already. I took AP calc in high school and still struggled a bit. NOT for the average math student.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: I just want to start off by saying I took this class during the summer and the workload was so terrible. In our last segment of homework, she assigns 162 questions (10 Assignments) on Pearson which is ridiculous. If you do not like Pearson don't take this class because it is entirely based on Pearson during the summer and she doesn't help.

Not a suggested professor. Very non-assistive. Can come off as rude when you ask a question in or out of class. Doesnt respond to emails very quickly. Unnecessarily complicated attendance post every class that we dont start till 7 mins before the end of class (even though theyre due by the end of class). Definitely wouldnt take again...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy

comment: Absolutely Awful professor. Everyone in the class failed the first test causing which forced her to try and give us extra credit opportunities. She goes through chapters very quickly. Makes sarcastic comments if you don't understand and gets frustrated with you. extra credit was the only reason people in the class passed. Final exam is cumulative.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: If you don' have skills in algebra get ready to restudy everything if you want to pass this class. I don't recommend this teacher due to the amount of difficulty. She does give a lot of extra credit but not enough to make it smooth sailing. Shes also very stubborn and adamant with her reasoning, you wont get anything good out of here. Bad teacher
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Although she is a great person her teaching style is extremely lecture heavy. If you are able to understand the content you will do well, I did well luckily b/c of her odd grading system. Is not the worst option but I am sure there is better.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: This was easily one of the worst professors I have ever had. She marked correct answers as wrong on my test and she doesn't help students at all. The way we had to study was by doing our homework which was not explained at all. DO NOT TAKE!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: My experience with professor Shi was mediocre. Her lectures are surprisingly informative, and she does a good job at explaining topics, but her WebAssign homework assignments can be lengthy at times. Don't wait till the last moment to do them, trust me. Her tests are straight from the homework, but her grading criteria is hard to follow.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Shi is okay. Her lectures are pretty good, all course homework on webassign is due at the end of the semester. Her tests are basically straight from the homework. Her grading criteria is pretty vague. She replies to emails fairly quickly and will work with you if you really show you care. Would take her again if there were few options.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: The class isn't too bad but her grading criteria is not clear when you take her tests. Your grade is what they are, she doesn't curve. However, she does give extra-credit through the Webassign. She is rude when you try to ask any questions. Even more rude in emails. I DO NOT RECOMMEND this professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: This professor is very arrogant and rude when asked any questions by students. Also she will mark your answers on a test wrong even if its right and never correct it even when given proof. Also she will take a week to respond to any email then blame it on you for not taking initiative. She is not a understanding or caring person. DO NOT TAKE
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Tests are split in half where you can receive partial credit on the written portion on D2L but not on Mathlabs. She is specific on grading and will only grade on notations you've used in class (so you can't use another method but hers). She does, however, gives plenty of extra credit. Lastly, she can tend to be snarky and will call you out.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: 5 test, no drops, no curves, even if she mistakenly marks an answer wrong on a test, she wont change the grade even if she announces the you had the correct answer. All lectures are just her doing random problems with now context and doesnt teach any theory. No office hours, and 5 day response times to any email. Worst teacher Ive ever had
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: IF YOU DO NOT HAVE ADVANCED ALGEBRA AND PRECALCULUS SKILLS DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. YOU WILL GET NO REVIEW AND ARE EXPECTED TO HAVE DEEP KNOWLEDGE OF THESE SKILLS. In her lectures she will skip the algebra steps assuming we all can do these in our mind. Test is graded by use of proper notation and work shown. We had 2 extra credit chances. CAUTION!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: So much extra credit!! She responds quickly to emails. I didn't use her lectures to learn the material rather than teaching myself off of pearson and examples.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She explains everything and gives alot of examples. If you do your homework, you will literally be fine. She is always willing to help and is rlly nice too. Sometimes she gets kinda confused w/ her own work tho lol. This class wasn't hard if u pay attention and ask q when ur confused. so get help when u need it. dont blame the prof.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Legit, show up, sit in the back do the WebAssign. Disregard everything else. I have never struggled with math classes before (got A's in all the calc classes) This class's difficulty was raised entirely from her. Tests were legit printouts of the WebAssign questions. She is a stickler for points and at all costs do not ask a question during class.

She explains techniques from prerequisite Calc classes, so you won't feel left behind if you're rusty on certain techniques. No curveballs on tests and some test questions were pulled straight from the OPTIONAL homework. Homework ranged from 5-25 problems per chapter so it's doable with a busy schedule. If you do the homework the class is easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She grades on a point scale, so you can miss a test completely and still get an A. The material she covers is difficult to pick up on, but she does a great job of going over examples in class. I don't know why she has such a poor rating. This is the second time I have taken her for a different course and would ddefinitely take again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Say goodbye to your 4.0. Takes full points off of questions for mistakes as minor as rounding errors. Passed out a formula sheet once, which is required for exams and not available online; she refuses to provide copies to anyone who missed class or happened to lose it. And finally, she responds to questions by insulting anyone who dares ask them.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor I have ever had! A ton of WebAssign homework, did not give study guides, tests were filled with word problems that counted for half the points on the tests which she didn't prepare the class for, and she did very little to prepare the class for any of the tests. This class shouldn't have been as hard as she made it. DO NOT TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: You definitely need to participate and go to class if you want to pass. Tests are difficult, but not that extreme for a Calculus class. Makes it VERY clear that there will be NO curve or bumping of grades, but she does replace your lowest test grade with your quiz grade, which is crazy good. I got a 78, 42, 80, and 70 on the FE and pass w/ an 88.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Just terrible. There is a reason 50% of her class grade is participation and homework and that reason is that otherwise the whole class would fail. Even if you study for every test, understand the topics, do all the homework, and go to class- you will still end up with only a b at best. I had all other A's in third semester, but this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She posts homework for the unit on WebAssign as well as practice tests. The questions for the test come straight from the practice tests, but if you follow these questions you will get it wrong on the test. Her grading does not make sense because she is so particular and only will accept one answer and only one way to get that answer. Good luck !
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She knows her subject well and is a nice person, but definitely all of her students are struggling. Her tests are awful. Our whole class had an average of 30 in couple tests! Her tests are nothing like her lectures, and everyone struggled. I would recommend to find another professor if you really need MATH 1190 for your major.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Prof Shi definitely knows what she's doing, but she assumes her students do, too. She skips steps, reads word for word from slides, and gets kind of irritated when the class is confused or doesn't respond to questions. She does, however, give extra credit, pop quizzes. Attendance is a heavy portion of the final grade, so I recommend going to class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Shi is knowledgeable in her field but her expectations are too high . Often doesn't work out hw problems so she doesn't realize much work they actually take. Gives easy quizzes, homework(lots), and worksheets but then chooses the trickiest most confusing problems for her exams. No feedback and answers questions with another question.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She was great. As long as you do the homework and make a somewhat okay grade on the tests, you will pass her class. Her quizzes are counted as extra credit and as long as you pay attention in class, you should do well on the quiz. Her accent is a little thick but you can still understand her. She really helps her students do well in the class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: You could fail every test & still make an A or B as long as you do all the online homework and come to class for her extra credit "quizzes"!  Her accent is thick but still understandable. She may not be very detailed when she goes over problems in class, but she's always willing to answer questions about material & homework in class & office hours
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Crazy amounts of extra credit. Its great.  You could do fairly bad on a test and make up for it with all that credit.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is hard to understand sometimes with her accent and just does example problems all class without really explaining  much. Go to class everyday because she gives extra credit for one problem quiz questions almost everyday and they add up.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Complete trash. Do yourself a favor and don't take her. all she does is read off the slide, literally word for word. She'll READ 5 formulas in a row without explaining it. Terrible at explaining her work, she'll skip steps because she does them in her head.  Daily quizzes for extra points. DO THEM. LOOK THEM UP.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Tests come from practice problems that she uploads (exact same problems) so as long as you know all of those problems you are guaranteed a good grade on the test. The homework isn't bad just space it out or it seems like a lot. Participation is not mandatory but go for the daily quizzes, just for extra points.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you have not taken high school AP calculus do not take her. All se does is read off slides and does not explain her examples well. She skips steps in the examples and expects the students to understand how she got from one step to another without showing all the work. She also gets annoyed when the class does not understand. HARD TESTS!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is nice but at times the quizzes are only participation grade but after test 1 she decides to start grading them for some reason and the material is pretty easy if you already have the knowledge. The tests are hard
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class will probably be my greatest regret for choosing classes late. She is not a very good teacher as I already knew most of the material from AP classes in high school, but still did badly. She teaches you the easy problems in class, then tests you over the harder ones and she repeats everything. EVERYTHING! At least 3 times or more.

There were only four tests and a final in this class, but formula sheets were given on all of them. Homework was online and always due on the day of the test. She goes quickly through lectures but is very proficient and knowledgable about her material. She expects students to be VERY FAMILIAR with their trig identities, values, and properties.

Professor Shi is a great person! She does have an accent but it's not hard to understand what she is saying.  If you need help and are not good at math, do not take her. She doesn't teach well; she does the examples on the bored and doesn't explain it well and then expects you to know it. The good news is she gives a TON of extra credit to help you

Even if you can't do math, she's got a good bit of extra credit for attending that can pull you through. Her accent is thick, but completely understandable. She's got a sense of humor, but it tends to be at your expense, so be careful not to get in that line of fire!

One reviewer said that she was difficult to understand. So not true. Her accent is noticeable, but shouldn't inhibit your learning in any way. She's kind of funny which gives her points. She has two tests and a final. Homework is required. You don't have to attend class, but you get bonus points (which you will want). She explains everything
Dr Shi is really nice and tries to help her students as much as she can.  She has an accent but she's really easy to understand.  She tries her best to make boring material fun.

Professor Shi doesn't really teach; she just reads off of the notes on the board. She also has a thick accent and it's very hard to understand her. Class isn't mandatory, but attendance is taken through daily quizzes and you can earn 5 bonus points per quiz just for trying, which is nice. However, I wish that I had never signed up for this class.
